page.title: 19ROADS AND TRANSPORT
page.content:
Okeford Fitzpaine is situated about s mile from the main A357. The nearest railway is at Gillingham and there is a strong sense of isolation amongst village people. Most of the younger families have a car, but many of the older or poorer inhabitants rely on the bus service which travels twice daily to Sturminster Newton and Blandford, or on the special market day services to these two towns.
In a recent survey in the village, there are 159 cars and 11 motor bikes in use. Some concern has been expressed about the heavy vehicles travelling through the village, and the general speed of traffic.
